computer.builtInGames: Primitive monitor, various languages in cartridges
computer.description:
The IQ-151 was a Czechoslovakian home computer manufactured by ZPA Novy Bor (Novy Bor being the town where ZPA was based). It was mainly intended for educational purpose and was actually supplied to all types of Czech schools.
The main peripheral was a standard cassette recorder, but several modules could be connected to 5 built-in expansion slots: VIDEO (display), BASIC (interpreter), BASIC G (graphic Basic interpreter), GRAFIK (256 x 512 graphics), STAPER (printer), MINIGRAF (plotter) _______________________
computer.graphics: 512 x 256 - Semigraphics mode with the GRAFIK external module
computer.keyboard: 71 key with function and arrow keys
computer.language: Primitive monitor, various languages in cartridges
computer.name: IQ-151
computer.peripherals: CONSUL 2112 or 2113, MINIGRAF 0507 (Aritma), SESTYK (teleprinter connection), printer, tape-recorder TESLA M710A or K-10 (external memory), Basic G, VIDEO , TAPER external module (printer connection), GRAFIK external module (256x512).
computer.ram: 32 KB, up to 64 KB (then MIKROS OS could be used)

shot.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>&gt;&nbsp;BOTH SIDES</strong></font><br><blockquote>On the left side one spots the dual video jacks (TV set and monochrome composite monitor),the dual tape recorder DIN sockets and the power switch.<
<br><font color="red"><strong>&gt;&nbsp;REAR SIDE</strong></font><br><blockquote>A basic cartridge is inserted in one of five cartridge slots.<

<br><font color="red"><strong>&gt;&nbsp;KEYBOARD CLOSE-UP</strong></font><br><blockquote>The keyboard is really dreadful, even worth than that the Sinclair ZX-81's which is the reference in poor keyboard. When you type a key, it doesn't sink, so you never know either the typing is valid or not.<br> Eack key have up to four functions, depending on the function key typed simultaneously (Shift, Control or Function). <

<br><font color="red"><strong>&gt;&nbsp;INSIDE</strong></font><br><blockquote>All of the ICs and components come from Eastern Europe. Most of the ICs come from Tesla, Tchekoslovaquia, some others from Russia. <br><br> <b><font color="blue">(1)</font></b> ROM cartridge connectors<br> <b><font color="blue">(2)</font></b> Monitor EPROMs<br> <b><font color="blue">(3)</font></b> RAM chips<br> <b><font color="blue">(4)</font></b> Tesla MHB8080A microprocessor<br> <b><font color="blue">(5)</font></b> Tesla MH3212 8-bit accumulator-counter<br> <b><font color="blue">(6)</font></b> Russian version of the 8255 PIA (Programmable Interface Adapter)<br> <b><font color="blue">(7)</font></b> Keyboard connector<br> <b><font color="blue">(8)</font></b> Power supply unit. The "gold" heat sinks are fixed to the case when closed. <
<br><font color="red"><strong>&gt;&nbsp;RAM CHIPS CLOSE-UP</strong></font><br><blockquote>The 32 KB RAM is composed of 16 Russian RAM chips labelled K565P.<

computer.sound: One voice sound generator, built-in speaker
